alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Southeast Fayette (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 12:46PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fayette County through 115 PM EDT... At 1246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Babcock State Park, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor water issues could be possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Rainelle, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill and Thurmond. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 14 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
